text: == Central People's Government (1949–1954) == ;Chairman of the Central People's Government * Mao Zedong (1 October 1949 - 27 September 1953) Portrait Name (Birth–Death) Constituency Term of office NPC Vice Chairman 1 Mao Zedong 毛泽东 (1893–1976) Beijing At-large 27 September 1953 27 April 1958 I Zhu De The First Chairman of the People's Republic of China. 2 Liu Shaoqi 刘少奇 (1898–1969) Beijing At-large 27 April 1958 21 December 1964 II Song Qingling & Dong Biwu (co-serving) 21 December 1964 31 October 1968 III Ousted by Mao Zedong during the Cultural Revolution. – Song Qingling 宋庆龄 (1893–1981) Shanghai At-large Dong Biwu 董必武 (1886–1975) Hubei At-large 31 October 1968 24 February 1972 (Song) \---- 17 January 1972 (Dong) III Vacancy by ascension Both Song Qingling and Dong Biwu co-served as acting chairman of the People's Republic of China until the resignation of Song Qingling in 24 February 1972. Dong Biwu served the remainder of the term. Category:Chinese politicians Category:History of the People's Republic of China Category:China-related lists
title: List of presidents of the People's Republic of China
